intro: Waltheria americana var. elliptica, commonly known as the elliptic false nettle, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. Its seeds are encased in a hairy, three-lobed capsule that splits open when mature. This species is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks.
